I do think Nuuly should take care of this before sending out to people, because I had another coat with the same issue and it is a little confusing. It's easy to remove the stitch with your hands or a seam ripper if you're careful, and that is what I did because it's cold out here in the northwest! This item is boxy and wide with very short arms. Wore once with a long black sweater underneath to disguise the short sleeve.

Glad I got a size small - i normally wear medium in jackets but this one being oversized fit me perfectly. It was great for going out and super comfy! wish the discount was a little more then I would buy it but in the mean time - I give it 5 stars!
I loved this jacket. So easy to throw on over a casual outfit or wear for a night out. Would definitely rent again.
I am usually a small-medium and I ordered a small which fit great. A medium would have worked for more of an over-sized look. Otherwise its really cute and comfortable and warm!
I like the style of this jacket a lot - it’s a bit long and meant to be oversized - but the arms were super tight and short so I wasn’t able to actually wear it. Definitely recommend sizing up.
This jacket had a very body fit, and not very flattering for curves. It was cute and warm though.

links_reviews_title: I want to give it a 3.5
links_reviews_text: This jacket is very warm, with the fur lining, but the sleeves are really short. So you can't really wear it when it's cold since the sleeves are short but it's way too hot for 50-60 degree weather. I think overall the jacket is cool but a little cheap looking.
Tried this on, and no way would I wear this. It fit so awkwardly. I had a friend try it on who is more petite than me, and it fit her pretty well.
This jacket is great but a bit stiff. If your'e between sizes, size up!

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous but small on the arms
links_reviews_text: Loved it but it didn't fit my thicker arms.
Fun print and fun oversized coat! I personally probably should have gotten a petite size but loved the oversized style and especially the print. Not too hot of coat, perfect for fall or spring
This jacket is amazing. So beautiful, vibrant, cozy and surprisingly flattering for something relatively boxy. Got compliments on it every single time I wore it!

Love the print, love the cut! Made me super happy, used it as my everyday coat for the entire month. It's great for March/April when it's technically not winter in NYC, but it's still pretty cold. Love it!

Unique coat and very pretty and warm. The coat did look large on me but definitely just think I don't have the body type for this coat as I'm 5'3" and think it might look nicer on someone taller and/or slender.

I absolutely loved this coat. It was warm and slightly oversized for someone 5ft. but I didn't mind. It felt cozy and added interest to any outfit. I received so many compliments when wearing. I highly recommend.
Very huge otherwise it would be very cute to wear. Could not leave the house with it, would fit 2 of me inside. :)

Admittedly, my husband didn’t get the attraction, but my entire office did! This was so fun and practical and totally different. It run large - I’d be tempted to try an extra small the next time though I usually wear a medium/8. Just adores it!!

links_reviews_title: Size down once. Perfect March coat.
links_reviews_text: I usually wear a L and I got this in a M, it fits perfectly. It's warm enough for your typical Northeast 45-55 degree spring weather but not TOO warm, and I love the floral for spring! (I know, groundbreaking. But it's nice to bring some color back into my wardrobe!)

I love this coat and wore it all throughout the Scottish Highlands during a winter trip, and it kept me warm the entire time. There's nothing quite like being atop a snowy mountain in a winter coat covered in flowers :)

links_reviews_title: The coat that converted new customers to nuuly
links_reviews_text: This coat is such a killer statement piece! Every time I wore this coat out, women kept asking me where I got it from and I told them about nuuly (and gave them my discount code - gotta give and earn those referral points, Girls)! I wore the cost over the black jumpsuit I also ordered from nuuly most frequently, and also over a plain grey sweater and bluejeans (there's so much going on with the design I wanted to keep everything else understated). A great feature of this coat is that the cut and style is just so different from a lot of the styles in the states. It really reminded me more of the southeast Asian collared shirts I would wear as a kid. But the 'puffer' look and certain detailing elements were very western, giving it such a fresh and unique look. It really stood out. Would also just add that this coat was incredibly warm. It doesn't appear that way from the pictures, but I wore it out on a few colder nights here in Brooklyn and was very surprised at how warm I felt despite the wind and temperatures.
I am obsessed with this coat, I wore it almost every day I had it! I initially rented it for a trip to Iceland but then wore it on the reg. Big pockets, light, and warm- you can’t go wrong
This coat was so cool! I got so many compliments each time I wore it!

links_reviews_title: Really big, no shape, not as cute as on models
links_reviews_text: I tried wearing this coat with all sorts of bottoms and tops. It looked so cute on the models but it had no shape and was big. It was comfortable for wearing at my desk, around the house, but I never wore it out. Color was fun for winter, but overall just didn't like it on me.
More compliments than I can count. Big pockets are super useful. Could size down twice if you want a fitted look. For true cold weather you’d want to wear a scarf since it’s a normal neckline. LOVE.

The pattern is amazing but the sizing is completely off. I ordered a small and it looked like I was in a sleeping bag. The sleeves went past my hands and it's sort of triangularly shaped so it goes outward as it goes down so not a flattering cut for me. Reallyy wanted to love this but could not find a way to wear it. Was honestly so sad the pattern is truly beautiful!

Loved this one so much, I wish I could buy it. I’m a fan of collarless coats like this and the brightness always made me smile when I put it on. It’s really warm, and I got a lot of compliments. Highly recco.
Beautiful coat and fit. It's not as warm as it looks, so save it for the 45-50 degree days & higher
It's nice in principle but really oddly shaped on. wayyy more puffy then it should be.
Loved this jacket! Super warm with pockets. Fit true to size for a puffer jacket.

links_reviews_title: The Coolest Coat I Have Ever Worn
links_reviews_text: This coat is perfect! It's warm, but lightweight and SO CUTE!

Wore this coat a lot, winter in New England. Got tons of compliments and it fit well. But the lack of a collar was odd and unless I wore a large scarf with it, it would not have worked for colder weather.

This might have been the nicest coat I've ever worn! It was so lightweight yet so snuggly and insulating from the cold and the wind. I loved the deep front pockets too. This is the second Anna Sui item I've rented, and I have found her sizing to run large. I went with the XS instead of my usual S and it was perfect.
I sized down and it was PERFECT 👌. Not tight in the chest area and was so warm, cozy, and hella stylish! (Yes, I was born and raised in Oakland ca, don’t make fun)

links_reviews_title: beautiful print, fit didn't work for me
links_reviews_text: I loved the idea of this coat so even though boxy fits rarely suit me, I still put this in my nuuly! As expected - it did overwhelmed my frame so I didn't get to wear it, but such a cool coat overall loved the print and the trim!
Loved the print! Wore this much more than I expected to! It’s warm and really cute. Not waterproof FYI
this jacket was by far my favorite item of the box - it's such a statement piece! Fun, light yet warm. and very convenient.

This coat runs on the larger side. I'm usually between a S and M and sized down based on another reviewer's suggestion. Glad I did! this coat is cut for a boxy fit so a M would have looked too large on me. I'm tall (5'11") but found that the sleeve length was just right - a rare occurrence! The coat is warm but not warm enough for sub-freezing temps

links_reviews_title: So cute, a little lighter weight than i expected
links_reviews_text: This coat is so cute and although it's voluminous, it's actually very light weight. Not really a Deep Winter coat but good for days in the 30-50 degree (F) range
We got a cold front this month and I needed a puffer jacket. Definitely big and bulky as other reviews said, but isn't that the purpose of these? Kept me nice and warm.
True to size, but big and fluffy
Bulky and oversized, size down
Was not as soft as I was expecting. Pretty color and pattern though!
This has been a great quarantine jacket. I wore it with a red gown, I wore it with jeans, PJ's, just everything! It doesn't close in the front, fyi.

I just loved this, I wore it a bunch when out for walks or to go to the grocery store. It got a lot of compliments and seemed to cheer everyone up! It doesn't fasten in front but since it's getting nicer out that was okay. It's also super soft.
I LOVED this jacket so much, but quarantine hit before I could wear it out. I wore it on a few Zoom calls with friends for some fun color!

I can see why there's always a wait for this coat. It was warm, fun and ran oversized (which I wanted). It was a bit annoying that there was no front closure, but that would be the only con for me. It looks as pictured as was hard to send back!

Really pretty, soft, and warm coat--the pink is really vibrant and cheery on a gray day. My only complaint is that there's no closure, no hook or any way to actually close the coat. Even in April, it's cold in Chicago so I was forced a few times to keep my arms in front of me to keep the coat closed, otherwise, if you're only using it for special occasions then it's perfect!
The coat was super cute but weather was too warm to wear it.
Great statement coat.
I wanted to love this so badly, but even with a size 2, I was lost in it. The oversized look did not flatter me.
Rented this for an event called Bloom.🌸 Unfortunately, it was canceled. But it would have been perfect for this Spring themed party.

I wore this coat a lot! It was perfect for March in NYC because it was warm enough for those days in the 40-50s but the vibrant and colors and pattern made it appropriate for Spring. I'm a true 8 on top and the coat was an oversize fit, which I liked. There is no button or other way to close the front, but because it's a little bigger you can wrap yourself up in it.

I was not brave enough to actually wear this thing out. It was a little big on me and made me feel bigger than I wanted to feel. I think it runs very large. I wanted to wear it out and make a statement... but I just couldn't do it. I still think it's really fun and cute.
This coat is so cool, I am a pretty true 6, S/M in clothes and it was a little large but that is ok still was really awesome. Strangers have been stoppping me to tell me they love the coat.
Flattering cut / Gorgeous floral detail, I was hoping it would have been softer. :(

Warm, soft, and a major statement piece. It does have functional front pockets, but no way to secure it closed in front. I felt it ran a little large, which was fine because it wasn’t too tight around my shoulders!

I got so many compliments on this jacket- you will be noticed! It definitely runs big. I sized down from my normal 8 and it was still VERY roomie. I do with that it had hook and eye closures or some way to keep it closed. It was warm but I would say best suited for weather over 30 degrees. Not as warm as other faux furs I've bottowed.
This coat is definitely oversized and has no buttons but fun to wear!

Anna Sui is a Goddess. This jacket is no different. I felt fabulous every time I wore it. But! It wasn't actually as over the top as I was expecting! The pink/red flowers with the black background make it a lore more wearable than expected. I wore it to work (professional environment) more than once.
This was a wonderful jacket and I got lots of compliments! It is big but I liked the oversized look.
Every time I wore it, I received compliments. This coat is a walking ad for Nuuly.

I love this coat and get a ton of compliments every time I wear it. It goes with a surprising number of outfits and is so cozy! The only downside is that there are no buttons to close it, you just have to wear it open. Definitely recommend this piece!

I really loved wearing this happy jacket. The colors And texture are so fun. It wasn’t warm enough for February in Pittsburgh so I’ll have to rent it again for March. I just wish it closed. There are no buttons or hooks to keep it pulled closed.
Four stars only because it ran noticeably larger than expected and had no closure/button. Got so many compliments though!

If only I could keep this one. This jacket is GORGEOUS and it does have pockets! The colors are just as bright as they are in the photos and I received endless compliments on it. I wore it out on date night but I'm feeling brave enough to rock this to work.

I only wore this out twice because 1) It’s a loud with a capital L for me and 2) it’s pretty thick (and warm) and we’ve had a mild season. BUT. Oh my did I get compliments on it. Literally stopped by 3 strangers on a night out. It runs large but it’s intended to. I’m a pretty true 12 but this fit like a 14. It was nice to wear something that felt luxurious and made a statement.
Was hesitant to wear this coat because it is a little more flashy than I usually wear but I got so many complaints everywhere I went. Really comfortable and a great statement piece
It’s feels not as substantial as you would expect, but I ended up being reasonably warm. It’s pretty oversized, so I would size down unless your shoulders are wide.

Perfect rental jacket. Buying this or a flight to Europe is a tough call, but this is exactly why I love Nuuly. I wore this to the art museum and all around the city and got stopped every where I went. It brought me so much joy! Highly recommend. 10/10 would rent again
Runs a little big but made it just right to wear with sweaters. Tons of compliments. Loved the cheery colors and floral pattern.
Not as soft as I thought it would be but so beautiful. Vibrant color and great fit- got so many compliments!

links_reviews_title: MUST get - even cuter in person
links_reviews_text: This jacket was such a fun statement piece. The colors are even brighter in person and it's so easy to wear with anything black because of the dark undertones. 100% recommend! Will rent again next winter.
The coat was soft to the touch, beautifully detailed, and fit well. There were no buttons or means of closure, so that was tough on cold days! Lots of compliments from strangers though.

Usually wear a size 6 in dresses, but a size 6 was a tad too big. I'd say size down. It is a very loud and fun jacket -- I only got the chance to wear it out once. Fun if you want to have a bold night!
It was a great rental. Wouldn't want to buy because colors are so bold and would probably get tired of the print but a fun coat to rent!
I to say I LOVED this jacket is an under statement. It was the coat of my dreams. And a real head turner everywhere I went. Sad to return this one for sure.

links_reviews_title: This is the fun jacket that you didn’t buy!
links_reviews_text: Omg. So many compliments! For a girl with a bunch of sensible jackets for Seattle rainy weather - this jacket was fun and ridiculous and a total show stopper! The great thing about renting is you don’t have to be sensible all the time. Great with jeans on a date!
So many compliments! I would definitely buy this coat if it was not $700

this thing is spectacularly obnoxious and gorgeous. i loved wearing it; friends loved petting it. it runs pretty big, and just wraps around the front (which is cozy, but doesn't secure closed except when hugging one's self).
Fur in good shape, vibrant and colorful, so many compliments!
Nice coat, great length
Bulky and oversized, could size down
Tight across shoulders, cropped high, not good for a size 16
The PERFECT little jacket. Can be dressed up or down and looks so expensive.
Love this jacket so much, I don't want to return :( Fit perfectly and was the such a good balance of thickness to keep me warm but not to thick.
I wore this on many occasions - night out in NYC, casually to work, day drinks, etc. Such a fun statement piece and fits as expected.
Perfect for a night out, over a cute dress or all black. Probably could of dressed it down like the model did with white and blue jeans as well. Super warm and cute.
great fit and cut.
Wore this so many times my friends were probably sick of it, perfect for casual and more occasional putiftd
This would be great with jeans. I just didn't have the chance to wear it. Very bulky and warm.
I wore this jacket multiple times and loved it - paired it with a black dress for a party and with jeans and a top for dinner with girlfriends. Loved this rental!
Cute but was shorter than expected. It was slightly tight in the arms but not so much so that you couldn’t wear it
great jacket!
I'm not a big leopard person but thought I'd give it a try. Kept trying it on but only once did I find an outfit where the colors worked.

Never got to wear this out because shortly after my nuuly arrived, we were asked to SAH for CV-19. But, from trying on, fit perfectly, long like the photo shows. It was definitely more shimmery and shiny than the photo showed, but I liked it! Comfy, different.

Never wore it but really wanted to. Thought I could dress it down enough to wear at work but never found the right combo. I'll definitely rent again when I can come up with a styling that makes sense.
Wore this for an interview and to work and received so many compliments. Ended up purchasing because I loved it so much.
If you’re a blazer fan, this is a must!!
Unfortunately, the fit was far from cute. It just felt misshapen and not very flattering.
Thought this was really cute, but it came pretty wrinkled and left a trail of glitter behind me. Never wore it out.

This blazer fit tts and was fabulous for a night out on the town. I wish I would have had more occasions to wear it out. Only thing is the sleeves are a little long on my petite body so I had to roll them up

Pictures do NOT do the fabric justice - it’s super metallic and is both gold and silver. It is super slim and long, so i wore it as a dress buttoned up with nude sparkly fishnets and thigh high boots with a turtle neck underneath. Also wore with low cut black body suit and skinny jeans / booties. Literally got stopped on the streets several times asking where i got it! Want to buy
I wore this for a theme night out with friends. It fit great and was very flattering.

The blazer fit perfect! Reason for three stars was that it came wrinkled and the material was extremely difficult to steam/iron out the wrinkles. Also, the jacket flared more gold in person with instead of silver making it appear a little cheaper than it was.
This is a statement piece. If you’re not careful how you style it can look cheesy. But if you do it right, it’s very fun. “You look like lady Gaga in that jacket” was a line I heard. So...

I'll preface this review with the fact that I love all things glittery, sparkly, and shimmery. This jacket is so cute and is such a statement piece. It's fun because you can be casual while still looking dressed up and it takes away the problem of having to throw a boring jacket over your cute outfit. Instead the jacket is the statement. It looks like it's maaaayybee long enough be a dress style in the photo, but it is not, although it does a good job of covering your butt. The one caveat is that it does get little sparkles everywhere like a trail of fairy dust, which I didn't mind, but some might!
This was cute on the model, but in person looks a little cheap. Also, very long and thin, so didn't work so well with my body type. Fit was good.

This was great. Kept me super warm for CA. Didn't wear it much due to social distancing. It's more structured than I would have thought, I liked it. Arms are a bit long, keep that in mind if wanting to size up.
Loved this coat! It was so different and fit perfect. I work it for a weekend in NYC and received many compliments.
Loved this jacket. It’s definitely a little out there but it actually paired well with a lot of outfits. An easy way to jazz up a casual outfit. Def recommend!
I rented it as a second option for an outfit I needed for an event, so I didn't wear it- but it's really cute!
For me the fit was off. Short and overly boxy/large.
I loooove this coat! So warm and so classy looking with some skinny jeans and high boots. I wore it out with some friends and I got so many compliments

These definitely run small, so size up! It's hard to see in the product shots here, but there is a bit of a croc embossment pattern on the leggings. Combined with the plastic-y sheen, they looked pretty cheap once I put them on, so I never ended up wearing them after trying them on initially.

This fit me well and was comfortable. Didn't have any issues going over my hips or anything. I ordered up based on other reviews. Normally I'm a size S-M and the M fit me well including the length. It would have fit perfectly if it were an inch shorter maybe.
They felt cheap and fit terrible, so small and just bleh, couldn't wear
I total love how this looked online, but the fit was too tight for my body type. If the material was more breathable, I would have styled them with an oversized sweater.

I wore these pants a bunch and did love them but the sizing was very odd? Based on other reviews and because I wanted a looser fit instead of a legging, I sized up (usually a 27/28 and got a large). The legs fit great, the waist was way too big but no one can really tell when they’re on. Otherwise very cute pants, easy to dress up or down and they are lined so super warm!
fit very weird, would not recommend

links_reviews_title: love, but def size up, they run small.
links_reviews_text: love, but def size up, they run small.

I never wear an XL but ordered it in extra large because of other reviews. Glad I did because they fit and I loved the subtle print. I wore a long sweater to cover the baggy crotch but great otherwise.
These are really cute but sooo small. I typically wear a S or 27/28 in pants and couldn't even begin to zip these up.
I really liked these but they are soooo small. They run super tiny and were very tight. I dont have the right body for them.
I went out on a limb with these, and sadly they didn’t work out. I couldn’t even get them over my hips.

links_reviews_title: Fun winter jacket, but its huge.
links_reviews_text: Super cute and warm but its pretty big.

Loved this jacket. It was very warm and on trend. Loved wearing it out and about, but I did wear it inside my office a time or two and got some comments about it looking like a bathrobe. Maybe it did... But with the cozy factor I just didn't care. Great jacket.

this was actually so much warmer than I was expecting, the thickness is great for early spring in New England! definitely size way down as this is a classic free people oversized situation. super soft!!
Love this! Would have kept if it was still winter, but just won’t get much more wear. It’s super cozy and soft.

This is a SUPER cozy coat! Like wearing blanket. It was perfect for the 40-50 degree days here in New York. It doesn't button up super high so I needed to wear a big scarf to keep my neck/chest warm, but overall it was a great coat. Definite Cookie Monster vibes, but in the best way! It's also super oversized—I got a small and still had room to layer underneath.

Wore this everyday. It’s sooo cozy and feels badass in a way. I loved rocking it with big sunglasses and a top knot. It’s oversized for sure. Only complaint is the closure is weird- it’s low and doesn’t really feel closer because of the gap between the large buttons.

I ordered a size down and was still a little large but if I had gone one more size down it could've been too small. I loved the inner lining it was so comfortable and breathable and the jacket overall was warm. The fit looked a little odd on me just wear the arms bunched by the hands made it look a little puffy. Cute jacket though
I got so many compliments on this. It is one of the warmest coats and most comfy coats I have ever worn. Goes with everything - can dress up or down.

I loved this coat! I got a ridiculous amount of compliments every time I wore it, which was almost every day this month... It fits big and feels like a big cozy robe, but that's exactly what I was going for! It was so warm for a Utah February and looked good styled with any and everything. Loved the color and style. May need to keep...
I sized down from a medium to a small and it still felt overwhelming large.
I wore this around the house and it’s amazing but never out because it was comically HUGE.
Warm, soft and cozy with lots of compliments!
I got a small in this jacket and it is very large. This isn’t for a petite frame.

I usually like oversized coats and sweaters, but this came off more like a bathrobe than a coat. Maybe it was the color or just the length, I couldn't tell but I didn't think I would be able to pull it off in public.
This coat is super soft and cozy. It definitely runs large and I got some "bathrobe" vibes from it even when I sized down - it's not as structured as some other teddy style coats.

I gasped putting this jacket on, it is so.so.so.comfy - a small was oversized - I felt like P Diddy walking around bc it was so fluffy lol but whateverr. Its cozy af. I wore it at home laying on the couch, I wore it on a 'warm' winter Chicago day running errands, and kept me cozy in the office.
Such an amazing coat! So comfy and really really warm! Got a ton of compliments :)
So comfy. It feels like a warm hug whenever you put it on. I even used it as a blanket sometimes! Rent it.

Definitely a statement piece! Easy to dress up or down. It's basically like wearing a very chic blanket everywhere you go. ALSO: the lining is a really soft jersey cotton, so this coat breathes a little and is soft inside and out! Mine arrived with a tiny hole in the right pocket but I didn't even care, it was so soft and gorgeous
Got lots of compliments on it and it is sooooo comfortable. The color is beautiful.

I'm normally a S/M in things, for a coat I'd usually size up but I got a S for this one and I'm glad I did. The actual coat is the comfiest, coziest thing I've ever put on my body. When I tried it on fresh out of the box, I wore it around my house for hours because I didn't want to take it off. I ended up wearing it so many times, I should probably buy it. It's very cozy but doesn't block the wind so on windy days, I layered a shell or sweater under it. The pockets are big, the neck can be pulled up, and the whole thing is so stylish. I got 1000% compliments everytime I wore it.

links_reviews_title: Great as a bathrobe, less so as a jacket.
links_reviews_text: Maybe Teddy coats just aren't for me, but this was unreasonably big and unflattering. I usually size down in Free People clothes and even the XS was huge! My boyfriend comfortably wore this. It didn't pair well with casual or formal wear. The material was amazingly soft and would make a nice bathrobe.

links_reviews_title: So cute and warm but SIZE DOWN TWICE!
links_reviews_text: After "outgrowing" most of the winter coats in my closet, I was afraid to heed the reviews and size down on this. I got a L, which is my normal size, and it was comically large- think Macklemore's Thrift Shop. Despite its monstrosity, it was still cute enough that I wore it almost every single day. The elastic at the end of the sleeves was a lifesaver as someone with short arms. I wore it in DC, PA and Buffalo in January and was never once cold. I loved knowing I could wear pretty much anything, and if I threw on this jacket I'd be warm. Will most likely be re-ordering in a smaller size.

People will give you a hug in this coat and they won't let you go! I felt like I was wearing a blanket to work. Perfect for a super chilly day, I wore it in the snow and felt like an angel. Something about the stretch of the fabric makes it -extremely- comfortable and cozy.
Fits oversized (like most free people items), cute and warm. I wore this to NY in January and it kept me warm while walking outside.

links_reviews_title: Fun and warm but more dramatic than expected
links_reviews_text: Very fun teddy coat, but it was much larger all around than expected. And since it was pretty big it had a much more dramatic effect than I was expecting. Comfortable and warm!
Such a cozy comfy jacket! I never wanted to take it off. It runs huge so definitely size down. You won’t regret it!

Very cute and VERY warm. I get toasty easily, so I only wore it a couple times- hint* it was snowing. Was able to button it all the way up which is usually an issue with my body type. Really enjoyed it.
Too bulky, wasn’t flattering. Also was too big.
This coat is EVERYTHING! It is so comfortable and warm and soft. Cannot stop touching it!
Loved this one so much and got so many compliments!
I took everyone’s advice and sized down for this coat so the medium was perfect! It is extremely warm and feels like you are wearing a luxurious blanket. Lots of compliments too!
So many compliments. It was warm, great pockets, and super cozy. Hard not to buy!
Loved this. It was so soft and fluffy and warm. It was like wearing a cozy stylish cloud. Highly recommend!

Definitely oversized but thats how it is supposed to be! I got so many compliments on this coat and it was so warm, I wish I bought it!! I'm usually a size small and went with the XS in this and it was perfect. Its more like fleece teddy material though, very soft.
Style-wise, it was oversized... but my god was it comfortable! I didn't want to take it off. So soft and luxurious!

The idea of this coat is amazing. I love the green detail. I am a small gal 5'3" around 110 lbs. I expected this to be oversized but it was ridiculously oversized. Not for shorter and thinner girls. You will just disappear even in the small

This coat is amazingly warm and comfortable. I could live in it! I would not recommend it for going out at night though. It’s a very casual fit and is more suited for day to day use. I’m a size S and the S was quite oversized which was perfect for this type of coat!

I loved the look online and have been dying to try the teddy coat look, but this one isn't structured at all, and if you're at all broad shouldered, will make you look a bit like a line backer. I like the button detail, but the lining was really thin and a silky. I thought it might be staticky in the winter dryness. Overall, really cute, but not well thought out!

links_reviews_title: Fun winter jacket, but its huge.
links_reviews_text: Super cute and warm but its pretty big.

Loved this jacket. It was very warm and on trend. Loved wearing it out and about, but I did wear it inside my office a time or two and got some comments about it looking like a bathrobe. Maybe it did... But with the cozy factor I just didn't care. Great jacket.

I didn’t wear it out due to the Covid issue but tried it on and looked cute.
Fit like a glove, very stylish
Cute! Wore plenty of times. Not the highest quality - but didn’t matter! Felt good & looked cute!
Wore this with jeans and booties and loved it. The sleeves and collar are super cute.
This looked a little too worn for me to wear to any occasion - not comfy enough for the weekend and not classy enough for work
Felt pretty, dressed up, but still casual. Loved this top
I love the style of this but it was a little too tight and short for me. Runs a size small.
Perfect for dressing up jeans. Cute pattered
I loved this because ... was skeptical about it being too good girly, but the texture, pucker, and palette made it super versatile for any look.
I wore this to a winter wedding with sheer tights! I felt sexy and stylish. I was able to dance the night away and fit very well. The pockets were a plus!
Not great for short people
I wore this for valentines day and got lots of complements but found myself having to adjust my boobs from falling out a lot since its such a large style - I recommend sizing down.

This dress appears in photos to be a little bit narrower and more fitted than it actually it is. It is a very "babydoll" type fit. The front has some shape to the waistline but the neckline is super low cut and wide. The color is beautiful and my boyfriend loved it but I think that's because it was very cleavage heavy. It's cute, I might wear it again before the month is over, but it feels very site-specific. I wore this for valentines day with fleece lined leggings (because Minnesota in February) and thigh high black wedge boots. I also wore a white lace bralette under and a long boho style necklace
I had rented this dress for a trip to New Orleans, I needed something for a Stevie Nicks event and thought this would be perfect. I literally looked like I was wearing a velvet trash bag.

This dress/tunic is great. It’s very flattering and comfortable to wear. The neck line is rather plunging so if you are busty you may need a layer underneath. But if you aren’t like me you could just go with being a little daring. I like the tie up at the back allows you to decide how it sits on you. I’d recommend this one.

Beautiful wine color but for me that was about it. The shape didn’t do much for my body type I wore it once to get use out of it and noticed a lot of fuzz was falling off this dress. By the end of the day there was red thread everywhere. Not sure if this was just a defective dress or if they all do that. I would also recommend wearing a bralette or cami under, the top is very low cut.
wore with jeans and a chunky heel. really cute. the cuffs are bit big .
You'd have to have wide shoulders to pull this off. Definitely not for petites!

I love this top. It’s classic babydoll which I love. The material is heavy and it is oversized. I knew it was going to be. I wore this as a coat the first time, I still have it and may try wearing it alone.
I personally did not like this even slightly. It was way too big and made me look like I had no shape whatsoever. Wore it once to work and regretted it the whole day.
Go two sizes down if you can. Very large in the shoulders.
Super cute and comfy but the babydoll makes it extra big. Order a size down.

I never got to wear this one because it was giant. I usually am on the border between standard and plus size. Ordered an XL and it almost swallowed me whole. The material is heavy, so keep that in mind too. Not sure if I would have liked that if the shirt had been the right size.

I absolutely love this dress. I tried to wear it often even during the lock down from Covid-19, even just to walk my dog. I hope to see this dress again in the future. You can make this dress casual by wearing sandals or tennis shoes.
Very flattering style...the material is just heavy/clingy enough to show off one's figure but not too heavy that it's only for winter.

The reviews of this dress are right on --- everything about this dress is great except for the tummy area. I love the bell sleeves and the print, although the material felt cheaper than the price tag. I also feel slightly confused about the pocket square. Overall I enjoyed having this in my Nuuly.
This fit really weirdly. Bottom was true to size but the top half felt loose and just was overall floppy feeling.

links_reviews_title: So cute and professional yet casual
links_reviews_text: Loved this dress. I wore it during my professional work from home calls as well as on strolls around the hood.
Wish I could afford to buy, I even rented it for a second month because I loved it so much! I miss having this dress in my closet :( will hopefully buy in the future.

Not to be a Debby Downer, but I didn't love this dress. It fit, but it wasn't very flattering. Not forgiving at all in the stomach area - made a non-problem area into a problem area for me, which was unusual. It was pretty, but definitely not my fave.

I ordered this dress mostly just to see what a really expensive designer dress would be like, as I've never worn anything this expensive before. It wasn't for me, and it didn't really seem all that different than a $50 dress. The pocket square was wrinkly and didn't stay up. The fabric was not super comfortable. It just looked awkward, so I never wore it out.
Lots of buttons but print and fit were great. Love Anna Sui!

I'm typically a 6 or 8 (28-29" waist) and went with a 4 in this because it was what was in stock, and the 4 fit me perfectly. It's a really awesome dress, beautiful and unique and got a lot of compliments. If I could afford it, I'd buy it. My only minor complaint was that (due to the thin fabric), it wasn't very forgiving in the tummy area.
V cool and v comfortable
Was a little light for the Pacific NW alone so I wore a thin black turtleneck underneath. Wore it to brunch with some oxfords and got lots of compliments on the outfit.

This was such a great dress! I was a little skeptical getting material so light during the winter, but I wore tights underneath and boots over them and felt perfectly fine indoors (I usually feel cold most of the time). The dress was a little loose on the top and in the midsection - nothing that hung too loosely but it might have been nicer if the midsection were a little more fitted. I wore the dress to several events, including an entrepreneurs conference, for an interview, date night, and all-around Brooklyn on the weekend. It was perfect and felt really understated but ready for anything.
the dress looked horrible on me...truly. it actually looked like a saggy bag. however, i did manage to wear it but only with a sweater over it, so its purpose served more like a midi skirt.

Do not hesitate! Rent this dress!! It's so cute and so unique. It can be dressed up or down in my opinion. Got so many compliments. The little pocket square thingy didn't stay up on its own but I just tucked it in.

links_reviews_title: Cute dress, but not a show-stopper for me
links_reviews_text: This was a super cute print and I loved the sleeve shape. I thought the quality could have been better considering the label and retail price. The flower buttons and built in pocket-kerchief weren't my fav. I was happy to wear it once though!
such a great piece. quality material with an interesting collar detail. wore it a lot with black boots.
Wish I could buy this one!! Fit was so cute, layered easily with turtlenecks etc to change it up. Lightweight but not flimsy fabric.

I could never have afforded this dress without Nuuly. Its an odd, cool-girl only dress that a reasonable person would never chance looking silly in for $700. I looked silly in it, but I didn't care, I felt cool. I tucked in the pocket square and felt cooler.
I love this dress! Got many complements when I wore it - wish I could purchase it!

Are you kidding me with this dress!? It's gorgeous. Flowy in all the right places. I wore it to work, to Palm Springs, to date night. You can dress it up or down. It's *so* easy to wear. I thought the 0 was a bit large around the waist/torso area; otherwise it fit perfectly.
I thought I'd love it, especially with leggings or skinnies. The material and color were on point, but the shape looked weird on me. I don't think fit and flare is my jam.
I really loved this sweatshirt! It was comfortable and looked great with leggings. I’m normally a small but went with an XS and I’m glad I did because it runs a bit large.

I loved this!! I threw it on during our stay at home order all the time! Went great on a cooler day with leggings! Made a casual pair of leggings seem more stylish! Had to keep!! Wish there were more colors!
Wore this almost daily while working from home. The materials is so soft, yet thick enough to provide warmth. Love this & highlight recommend.
Loved this top!! Almost bought it. It's very athleisure chic. Perfect for snowy and chilly days to make your usual legging look a little upgraded. The color is also so cute too

I thought this could work in a cute, over-sized way, especially with the drawstring... but it just didn't. It was huge. I think it would be a super cute maternity sweatshirt! The color and fabric were high quality, so that's how it got the 2 stars.
I got so many compliments on this! I loved it for running errands, post-workout, lounging around the house. Thinking about buying it, and will definitely rent again.
Easy to wear athletic top
Perfect post yoga throw-over and lounge sweatshirt.

links_reviews_title: Super comfortable but weird cowl neck
links_reviews_text: I loved the material of this sweatshirt and could wear it everyday, but the cowl neck doesn't lie right. It's super stiff and didn't relax.
I liked that this is a dressier kind of sweatshirt because of the slightly scuba feeling fabric. Got a lot of compliments. Would rent again.

Loved this sweatshirt - made me feel stylish when wearing it with leggings, as opposed to a regular old sweatshirt that dresses me down. Mostly styled this with leggings or jeans and pair of cute, simple earrings for running errands!
I wanted to purchase because I love it so much!

Cute sporty top for the gym or lounge around the house, but even down sizing to a small I felt like it ran way too large preventing me from wearing it more than a few times. Neckline is a little awkward as we..
Really nice material and the elastic creates a cute shape. Beautiful color. Size down.
I loved wearing this to run around town, a little cuter than just leggings and a sweatshirt. The neck is high but flattering. The color is pretty and super soft!
Love this. It's a dressy sweatshirt, perfect for running errands or book club and still looking stylish. It is high waisted though.
this is the cutest top! i think i got 1000 compliments a day. recommend!
I loved this sweatshirt so much - will definitely rent again - it was comfortable and very cute, loved the drawstring. I am normally a L and the L fit great in a roomy way as seen on model.

It's oversized, but that's the style. The sleeves were too long too. That said, I got so many compliments, including from some unexpected sources that it really surprised me. Definitely a fun, casual, athleisure rental.

I am usually a size small in everything, but got this in XS based on reviews, and it was the perfect fit. I loved it. I'm 5'8" with long arms and it was cute and comfortable- the neck was not overwhelming. Wore it a lot!
I wore this so much. It is comfortable material and fit well. I like things to fit a bit big, and this did. I got a lot of compliments on this!
Soft, comfortable, warm enough, love it
Not a warm sweatshirt but super cute and stylish!! Got compliments all the time and was often wearing it when I was “dressing down” - running errands, wearing sweats, in transit, etc

Loved the cut of this sweatshirt (the drawstring gives you a waist!) and the color is pretty. I paired with camo leggings for a hike in Scottsdale and with black yoga pants on a ski trip. The neck is a BIG scuba neck so it did lay a little funky. Amazing matte-like fabric!
Loved this comfy athleisure piece! The color was great and it was super soft. Sleeves were a tad long, but bearable!

I got so many compliments every time I wore this sweatshirt. It’s so unique! The fit was perfect since the cinch tie is adjustable. The only thing I would say is that the sleeves run a little long but I just rolled them up.
I loved this sweatshirt. It was dressy and casual at the same time and looks great with leggings or jeans. It is very flattering on as well.
I was so looking forward to this piece, but unfortunately it was very boxy and made me feel a little odd, so I never wore it out. I don’t think sizing down would’ve helped much. Great color, though!

This is a stiff, smooth material. Difficult to manipulate the neck. Did not wear, my husband saw me in this and immediately thought I should wear this to our school auction with a sword so I would look as I strongly resembled a character from Zelda (Circa 1987)
Cute top but size way down!
Felt so comfortable. Loved this too but it does run a little big.
cute. love the color but it’s like a scuba material so it’s boxy. if you’re into that def get it.

This sweatshirt was super comfy but definitely wide. The length was right so I wouldn’t suggest sizing down though. I wore it with really skinny jeans and heeled boots so it worked but it was somewhat of a tent.
I wore this mostly to and from work out classes and to run errands. Comfort of a sweat shirt without looking like you just woke up. Love the cinched waist and the bulky collar.

I really loved this one. The fabric is a little more structured than I was expecting from the photo, almost a flexible neoprene feel. This is a good thing, in my opinion, because it made the silhouette super flattering in structure and also wrinkle-resistant. This was totally wrinkle-free when it came out of the packaging. It is definitely oversized; I was surprised the L fit around the hips as I'm usually a 0X there. Again, the structured fabric is a godsend to a pear-shaped silhouette. Love the drawstring waist, making it very flattering even on a short-waisted torso. The collar I wasn't in love with; the stiffness made it lie a little strangely. Also, the sleeves were about 6 inches too long for my short arms. Had the sleeves been shorter, I would probably have kept this, however, as I loved it that much. Super flattering and comfortable, perfectly oversized. Definitely a favorite!

I never wanted to take it off! Very comfortable and cozy sweatshirt, with fun and flattering details. Loved the color too. My only complaint is that the sleeves are quite long, but I was able to roll them a couple times and it looked fine.
Fit as expected, but is a bit oversized and great!
It’s boxy but that’s the look I wanted. The perfect athleisure sweatshirt to just throw on.
Got this as a replacement for another item from Varley I tried to rent, and was pleasantly surprised with how much I liked and wore it! It's fantastic quality and so soft. Held its shape well too!
A fancy sweatshirt with shiny gold snaps on the sides, to satisfy all of your athleisure needs. Color was pretty much exactly as pictured, maybe a tiny bit more pink.
Fit was a bit too boxy for my liking. The arms were a bit too short for me, I’m 5’10”. Pretty material and detail with the buttons.
The color and material are so fun! On me, it was incredibly boxy.

links_reviews_title: Great quality, wish sleeves were longer!
links_reviews_text: I love the cream color and weight of this sweatshirt. Really well made. I liked that it had a boxier, more structured feel. The gold snaps on the side seams gave it a more tailored look. Looked cute with leggings and front tucked with high waist jeans. If the sleeves were longer I would have definitely kept it. I am 5'8 and they weren't as long on me as the model.
Wore this so much that I bought it. Comfy and cute, dressed it up with jeans and heals and also wore it with sweatpants on the weekends. It’s adorable!
This was a great low key piece that had cute detail to make it interesting.
Very boxy, length too short. Not a flattering fit for me, Stiff material. Just blah.
This didn’t work for me. It was super boxy, and the fabric was too thick.
This sweatshirt is beautiful with nice thick, cozy material but it was too boxy for me and had really wide arms.
The quality is stellar!!! Super fine knit, thick scuba-ish texture, and great rose gold snaps make it easy to pair with any bottom.
Great fit, true to size and very pretty for a sweatshirt

The keyhole in the front is pretty large, so if you're in between sizes, size down! Otherwise you are swimming in fabric (and at risk of flashing!). Really soft material and fun puffy sleeves. Great work piece!
Just okay - I wore it once, and didn't feel strongly either way. It gave me a work day outfit, but not one that I was excited about!

Can be dressed up or down. Very comfortable. Sleeves are the perfect length on me, however I have short arms so keep that in mind. Styled with black wide leg jeans with a frayed hem, messy bun, and hoops.
So cute & easy! Could wear to work with jeans, and also dress up a little more for casual night out.

The colors and fabric are so pretty with this blouse! I was so excited with it straight out of the bag. However, the fit was odd and the collar didn't lay nicely. The fabric also wrinkled incredibly fast. It was a blouse I was hoping would make me feel put together, but I felt I had rolled out of bed when I wore it (even after ironing). It fit nicely in the arms and bust (my two most difficult areas for blouses) but there was so much access fabric throughout the midsection that it was impossible to tuck into jeans making me feel larger.
Just a very strange fit.
I wore this shirt for a work trip and it did the job however the tie and chest area was a little big and I felt like it wrinkled really easily. Didn't hate but didn't love!
I ordered this knowing it wasn't exactly my style and wanted to try something new. Didn't like it for me but it fit well.
